005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IStringItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
013
014import java.util.List;
015
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
017
018/**
019 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
020 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#string">string</a>
021 * data type.
022 */
023public class StringAdapter
024    extends AbstractStringAdapter<IStringItem> {
025  @NonNull
026  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
027      List.of(
028          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "string")));
029
030  StringAdapter() {
031    super(IStringItem.class, IStringItem::cast);
032    // avoid general construction
033  }
034
035  @Override
036  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
037    return NAMES;
038  }
039
040  @Override
041  @NonNull
042  public IStringItem newItem(@NonNull Object value) {
043    String item = asString(value);
044    return IStringItem.valueOf(item);
045  }
046}
